intro: Myrcia icnii, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Myrcia icnii thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils. It has been introduced to other regions, where it can become invasive due to its rapid growth and adaptability.
